title: Entitled teacher gets skunked in the woods after ignoring former student: 'I tried to warn you about the skunk'
description: Everyone wishes some kind of comeuppance for that one teacher who gave them a rough time in high school. Perhaps you hope someone calls them out, or they get fired, or they slip on a banana peel in the cafeteria. No one could dream up this perfect confluence of events.This student, who was now over ten years out of school, was still haunted by the treatment she received from one of her former teachers: Ms. Samantha. Ms. Samantha was an unkind excuse of a "professor" whose words had a long-term impact on this author and their educational future. Years after the damage was done, the author was visiting home and was taking a long walk in the park. That's when a chance encounter with a skunk and another chance encounter with Ms. Samantha herself gave the author the perfect plan. Keep scrolling below for her full account of the tense exchange with Ms. Samantha!
author: Ben Weiss

title: City slickers try to sue small town rancher for getting them ticketed for ‘trespassing’ after backpacking on his private property, rancher gets the last laugh: ‘I got the payment…'
description: Some people prefer the big city life to small town living, and that's fine. The accessibility to public transportation, the people watching, the endless things to do, etc. It's a faster pace of life and some people thrive in that environment. However, some people are the complete opposite and thrive in places that are slower. That is when small town/country life is embraced! People who are like this go out to find a secluded plot of land for themselves where they can live in peace and solitude and only see people when they so choose to. In the city, the second you step outside of your door, you are likely to encounter another person. In the country, you're more likely to encounter a woodland creature before anyone else—and that's how they like it! Both have their negatives and positives.  However, if you are a visitor in either of those places, you know to respect the rules of the area. That means, reading the signs that tell you what you can or cannot do around town. Like, perhaps, "private property" and "do not enter" signs. They have those everywhere, it's not like you don't understand what they mean…
author: Elna McHilderson

title: Post-partum cat surrendered to animal shelter finds purrfect joy in raising litter of adorable baby kittens that might not have survived if she hadn't meownifested motherhood (Video)
description: You know the saying that's been going around now - he's not the step-dad, he's the dad who stepped up. Well, this is the momma version of that. We love seeing videos of animals adopting babies that aren't theirs. Like when this sweet dog adopted a tiny orange kitten, or this cat adopting an otter to grow up into being besties. It just goes to show that we, as hoomans, still have a lot to learn from our animal friends. In this purrticular case, however, the story is about a momma cat who was surrendered without her babies and saved a litter of neonatal kittens by being their mom.Without her, these kittens might not have survived. Sure, she may have been crucial to their survival, but we also think that they saved her a little bit, too. Sometimes, you just need a reason to keep on going, and these kittens were that for her. It's purrfectly adorable and meowgnificently heartwarming to see, so scroll down and watch this wholesome story below!
author: Blake Seidel

title: 23 Sassy Sunday Cat Memes Sending You Silly Vibes for the Weekend
description: Hello, cat pawrents. Do you enjoy your weekend so far? And what about your cat - does your cat enjoy having you all for themselves on the weekend? Because if we know cats, which we do, we think they'd want you to sass up your Sunday and have an extremely silly and cat-filled weekend. To sass up your Sunday and fill it with cats, you need to surround yourself with as many cats as pspspssible. The more cats you have around you - the more sass your Sunday will catch, creating a sassy weekend vibe for you. Just as your cat intends.Now, we know you might not be a crazy cat lady with 20 cats to meet the Sunday sass demand - and that's okay. Not everyone can be a successful crazy cat lady. But you can do another thing that's also a solution for meeting your cat's demands for sass - and that is with sassy Sunday cat memes. They're best for cat pawrents sassing out their Sunday for their cats.
author: Ayala Sorotsky

title: You've Got A Fast Car
description: Steam must have this motherfucker dialed in. Gabe is obsessed with self-published indie weirdness in fiction, and discovered tons of hot shit before it got optioned and made into movies. No doubt his predilection toward pervert horseshit has steered his algo to wash up all manner of strange treasure upon his shore, and the latest is the one he was just telling you about a couple days ago - Supercar Collection Simulator. One of this new wave of retail management games, this one has twisted incentives; it is a tour through the coal-black aorta of Capitalism itself. .

title: Error'd: Hot Dog
description: Faithful Peter G. took a trip. "So I wanted to top up my bus ticket online. After asking for credit card details, PINs, passwords, a blood sample, and the airspeed velocity of an unladen European swallow, they also sent a notification to my phone which I had to authorise with a fingerprint, and then verify that all the details were correct (because you can never be too careful when paying for a bus ticket). So yes, it's me, but the details definitely are not correct." Which part is wrong, the currency? Any idea what the exchange rate is between NZD and the euro right now?   An anonymous member kvetched "Apparently, I'm a genius, but The New York Times' Spelling Bee is definitely not."   Mickey D. Had an ad pop up for a new NAS to market. Specs: Check Storage: Check Superior technical support: "   Michael R. doesn't believe everything he sees on TV, thankfully, because "No wonder the stock market is in turmoil when prices fall by 500% like in the latest Amazon movie G20."   Finally, new friend Sandro shared his tale of woe. "Romance was hard enough I was young, and I see not much has changed now!"   [Advertisement] Plan Your .NET 9 Migration with ConfidenceYour journey to .NET 9 is more than just one decision.Avoid migration migraines with the advice in this free guide. Download Free Guide Now!
author: Lyle Seaman

title: CodeSOD: Static State
description: Today's Anonymous submitter was reviewing some C++ code, and saw this perfectly reasonable looking pattern. class SomeClass { public: void setField(int val); int getField(); } Now, we can talk about how overuse of getters and setters is itself an antipattern (especially if they're trivial- you've just made a public variable with extra steps), but it's not wrong and there are certainly good reasons to be cautious with encapsulation. That said, because this is C++, that getField should really be declared int getField() const- appropriate for any method which doesn't cause a mutation to a class instance. Or should it? Let's look at the implementation. void SomeClass::setField(int val) { setGetField(true, val); } void SomeClass::getField() { return setGetField(false); } Wait, what? Why are we passing a boolean to a method called setGet. Why is there a method called setGet? They didn't go and make a method that both sets and gets, and decide which they're doing based on a boolean flag, did they? int SomeClass::setGetField(bool set, int val) { static int s_val = 0; if (set) { s_val = val; } return s_val; } Oh, good, they didn't just make a function that maybe sets or gets based on a boolean flag. They also made the state within that function a static field. And yes, function level statics are not scoped to an instance, so this is shared across all instances of the class. So it's not encapsulated at all, and we've blundered back into Singletons again, somehow. Our anonymous submitter had two reactions. Upon seeing this the first time, they wondered: "WTF? This must be some kind of joke. I'm being pranked." But then they saw the pattern again. And again. After seeing it fifty times, they wondered: "WTF? Who hired these developers? And can that hiring manager be fired? Out of a cannon? Into the sun?" [Advertisement] Picking up NuGet is easy. Getting good at it takes time. Download our guide to learn the best practice of NuGet for the Enterprise.
author: Remy Porter

title: 4 Men Caught Smuggling Hundreds Of Ants

title: Pros And Cons Of Bringing Back Extinct Species
description: Colossal Biosciences claims it has brought back the dire wolf, a species that went extinct thousands of years ago, by editing the genes of gray wolves. The Onion examines the pros and cons of resurrecting extinct species.
